title: User talk:Michael Goodyear/Archive 10
content: '''2015''' == Great work at ''Narcissus'' == I'm not a great fan of barnstars, etc. so I'll restrict myself to words: you've done great work at ''[[Narcissus]]'' – it's far beyond GA status, in my view. [[User:Peter coxhead|Peter coxhead]] ([[User talk:Peter coxhead|talk]]) 15:57, 29 October 2014 (UTC) : Possibly an obsessive personality! Coming from you, that is praise indeed. I agree, barnstars don't mean much, but rather we should remember Christopher Wren's epitaph - Si monumentum requieris.... ::It takes one obsessive to recognize another... :-) [[User:Peter coxhead|Peter coxhead]] ([[User talk:Peter coxhead|talk]]) 16:37, 29 October 2014 (UTC) :::Hear, hear. An incredible amount of work there. Well done. Herrick's finer work (in my opnion): [http://www.poetryfoundation.org/poem/176773]. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 23:13, 4 November 2014 (UTC) ::::"Now the full throated daffodils, ::::Our trumpeters in gold, ::::Call resurrection from the ground ::::And bid the year be bold. ::::Today the almond tree turns pink, ::::The first flush of the spring; ::::Winds loll and gossip through the town ::::Her secret whispering." :::::-- [[Cecil Day-Lewis]] ::::Thanks. Odd the Dab bot didn't spot Pausanias. Yes, there are many good examples, but one has to be selective - might get it into a footnote. --[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 00:44, 5 November 2014 (UTC) :::::Although I'm not sure Shakespeare ever wrote a poem about daffodils? He references them twice in ''[[The Winter's Tale]]'', but the verse: ::::::"When daffodils begin to peer, :::::::With heigh! The doxy over the dale, ::::::Why, then comes in the sweet o’ the year; :::::::For the red blood reigns in the winter’s pale." :::::is, in fact, a song by the comic thief [[Autolycus]]. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 23:08, 5 November 2014 (UTC) :::: Daffodils come before the swallow dares and take winds of March with beauty (Winter's Tale) - see [[Shakespeare garden]]. Maybe I should have been more explicit in my referencing? --[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 00:57, 6 November 2014 (UTC) ::::: Only the worst kind of literary pedant would ever raise any concerns, I'm sure. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 08:40, 6 November 2014 (UTC) I think it's great that so much work was put into this article but this is too intimidating for a GA review - or else I would do one! The most obvious thing I noticed reading the lead was the total absense of wikilinks, it looks quite barren. Yes, overlinking is bad, but linking Amaryllidaceae, perianth, and others where they first appear when reading is a good idea. Anyway, thanks for all the work! [[User:Hekerui|Hekerui]] ([[User talk:Hekerui|talk]]) 15:25, 18 November 2014 (UTC) :That was deliberate - having gone through GA many times - I got told to remove all wikilinks and references from the lead! It is only supposed to be a summary. Of course every time I go for GA I get told something different! :( --[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 15:51, 18 November 2014 (UTC) :: This prompted a review of the MOS lead page and of FA articles from this project. Clearly I have been misinformed, and will restore the wikilinks. --[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 15:53, 20 November 2014 (UTC) :::[[Games for May]] - probably a little too tangential for Popular culture, alas. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 17:07, 20 November 2014 (UTC) ::::Um, yes! --[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 17:12, 20 November 2014 (UTC) :::::Although this one's a bit more contemporary: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RIGZiClZSnQ] "Daffodil Lament” is a song by the Irish band [[The Cranberries]]. It appears on their second album ''[[No Need to Argue]]''. Its subject is love and struggling with pain and rejection." [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 19:25, 20 November 2014 (UTC) ::::::No mention of that lovely [[DAF Daffodil|car]] either. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 23:40, 23 November 2014 (UTC) :::::::The use of the word in endless - but I think we need some sort of association with the plant --[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 23:47, 23 November 2014 (UTC) ::::::::Yes, they're all just [[New Fast Automatic Daffodils|New FADs]] really, aren't they. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 08:40, 24 November 2014 (UTC) :::::::::But also inspired by another [[Adrian Henri|poem]], of course. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 13:45, 24 November 2014 (UTC) OK. We could add a statement that the word daffodil has become used in popular culture, with a few links to examples.--[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 17:51, 24 November 2014 (UTC) :My problem with trivia is that I never know when to [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jxd9xsD1M2w stop]. (quite obviously). [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 19:39, 24 November 2014 (UTC) Here's what I meant: it's very good, one can tell that from reading bits, but the GA process is one of the few instances on Wikipedia where one gets a chance to have some extra eyes on something that one has put a lot of heart blood into, and I guess you would rather have someone go over the article and point out issues and suggest improvements for every section. Yes, one could simply do a quick read over and look at the criteria, but I would try a more detailed review and in that respect it's A LOT lol Best regards [[User:Hekerui|Hekerui]] ([[User talk:Hekerui|talk]]) 11:04, 25 November 2014 (UTC) :Naturally, I agree with everything you say - so you think I shot myself in the foot by trying too hard? better to aim low first? :Would it help if I spun off more daughter pages? I have created three so far. --[[User:Mgoodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Mgoodyear#top|talk]]) 16:23, 26 November 2014 (UTC) Though it is a good article, I have talked about splitting the article into three: The botanical info would go under the title [[Narcissus (genus)]], the horticultural and medicinal info would go under the title [[Daffodil]], and the historical/cultural info would go under the title [[Daffodils in culture]]. [[User:Peter coxhead|Peter coxhead]] wanted your input on the split. What do you think? — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:RuneMan3|RuneMan3]] ([[User talk:RuneMan3|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/RuneMan3|contribs]]) 01:08, 9 March 2015 (UTC) : I had already responded over there. I have been considering moving further sections out for some time. I have already moved several so far. Culture was on my list. I think we should be very careful about using the term splitting. GA and FA pages use a lot of redirect hats to subpages, with a summary of that page underneath. I hope that is what we are talking about here. It is very easy to mess up a good page that has numerous internal cross references, to say nothing of the lead and references. I was going to leave the bibliography intact - this is the master page after all. So the process has to be done very carefully. I would strongly advise against anyone trying to create multiple subpages simultaneously. And anyway each subpage should preserve GA status and be separately reviewed. Do you want to leave it with me since I am very familiar with the structure of the page which I wrote pretty well from scratch? Assuming there is concensus on the necessity for this, and not just a make work project.--[[User:Michael Goodyear|Michael Goodyear]] ([[User talk:Michael Goodyear#top|talk]]) 03:35, 9 March 2015 (UTC)

title: Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/2011 October 10
content:
{{#ifeq:{{PAGENAME}}|Special:Undelete| |{{#if:|
}} {{#ifeq:{{NAMESPACE}}|Wikipedia|{{#switch:{{NAMESPACE}}|= |
}}|{{error:not substituted|Archive header}}
}}}} {{#if:|
}}{| width = "100%" |- ! colspan="3" align="center" | [[Wikipedia:Reference desk/Mathematics|Mathematics desk]] |- ! width="20%" align="left" | < [[Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/2011 October 9|October 9]] ! width="25%" align="center"|<< [[Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/September 2011|Sep]] | [[Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/October 2011|October]] | [[Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/November 2011|Nov]] >> ! width="20%" align="right" |{{#ifexist:Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/2011 October 11|[[Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/2011 October 11|October 11]]|[[Wikipedia:Reference desk/Mathematics|Current desk]]}} > |} {| align=center width=95% style="background: #FFFFFF; border: 1px solid #003EBA;" cellpadding="8" cellspacing="0" |- ! style="background: #5D7CBA; text-align: center;" align="center" | '''Welcome to the Wikipedia Mathematics Reference Desk Archives''' |- | The page you are currently viewing is {{#ifexist:Wikipedia:Reference desk/Archives/Mathematics/2011 October 20|an archive page|a [[Wikipedia:Transclusion|transcluded]] archive page}}. While you can leave answers for any questions shown below, please ask new questions on one of the [[Wikipedia:Reference desk|current reference desk]] pages. |} __TOC__ = October 10 = ==Transformation of a Gamma function== If I graph y=Gamma(x+1/2)/(sqrt(pi)*Gamma(x+1)), its a curve. But is there any transformation I can do to turn the graph into a graph of a straight line. For example, if I had y=10+ln(x), then I can plot exp(y) versus x and get a straight line. Is something similar possible for the above function? Thanks![[User:A Real Kaiser| - Looking for Wisdom and Insight!]] ([[User talk:A Real Kaiser|talk]]) 01:17, 10 October 2011 (UTC) :Certainly. Since Gamma(x+1/2)/(sqrt(pi)*Gamma(x+1)) is strictly decreasing on (-1/2,\infty), it has an [[inverse function]] (for this domain), meaning that f(y)=x (clearly linear in ''x''). I find it extremely unlikely that such a function can be determined explicitly though. [[User:Sławomir Biały|Sławomir Biały]] ([[User talk:Sławomir Biały|talk]]) 01:25, 10 October 2011 (UTC) == I would like to submit an article on the subject of Integer Factorization. == Integer Factorization is currently a subject of WikiPedia. I have determined a factoring method that is significantly different than the other methods presented so far. I have prepared an article that includes a document in Microsoft Word and a spread sheet in MicroSoft Excel. I would like to know first, where in WikiPedia do I submit my article and second, How do I include a spread sheet? I initially started to do this in "My talk" but I could not get it to accept the spread sheet so I did not complete the work. Now I am not sure that "My talk" is the right place to do this. If you could direct me to the appropriate pages or instructions, I would appreciate it. Thank you in advance. [[User:Variddell|Variddell]] ([[User talk:Variddell|talk]]) 01:16, 10 October 2011 (UTC) :It sounds as though you have some original research. Wikipedia is not the place to publish new results; Wikipedia is an encyclopedia that collects information that has already been published by reliable sources. Please see [[Wikipedia:No original research]] for more information. —[[User:Bkell|Bkell]] ([[User talk:Bkell|talk]]) 01:19, 10 October 2011 (UTC) : A better place would be a math forum like http://mymathforum.com/. What Wikipedia calls "original research" is not permitted here. [[User:CRGreathouse|CRGreathouse]] ([[User talk:CRGreathouse|t]] | [[Special:Contributions/CRGreathouse|c]]) 20:22, 10 October 2011 (UTC) == Existence of near-diagonalization == If A is a non-diagonalizable 2 x 2 matrix, prove that there nonetheless exists a matrix P such that P^{-1} A P = \begin{bmatrix} \lambda & 1 \\ 0 & \lambda \\ \end{bmatrix}

A being non-diagonalizable means that it must have exactly 1 eigenvalue.

AP = P\begin{bmatrix} \lambda & 1 \\ 0 & \lambda \\ \end{bmatrix}

\iff [Ap_1, Ap_2] = [\lambda p_1, p_1+\lambda p_2]

This shows that the first column of P is an eigenvector of A if \lambda is the eigenvalue, which always exists. How do I show that the other column of P always exists? [[User:Widener|Widener]] ([[User talk:Widener|talk]]) 04:56, 10 October 2011 (UTC) :[[Jordan_form#A_proof]] gives the proof for the general case. Or are you looking for something more elementary for this special case? -- [[User:Meni Rosenfeld|Meni Rosenfeld]] ([[User Talk:Meni Rosenfeld|talk]]) 07:34, 10 October 2011 (UTC) ::I suppose I am. [[User:Widener|Widener]] ([[User talk:Widener|talk]]) 08:02, 10 October 2011 (UTC) :::You can do this using the [[Cayley–Hamilton theorem]] (which itself is straightforward to prove for the 2x2 case), giving you (A-\lambda I)^2=0. ''A'' is not diagonalizable so for some p_2 you have (A-\lambda I)p_2\neq0. Denote p_1=(A-\lambda I)p_2, then (A-\lambda I)p_1=(A-\lambda I)^2p_2=0. p_1,\ p_2 are nonzero and one is not a multiple of the other (otherwise (A-\lambda I)p_2=0), so P=[p_1\ p_2] satisfies the requirements. -- [[User:Meni Rosenfeld|Meni Rosenfeld]] ([[User Talk:Meni Rosenfeld|talk]]) 09:29, 10 October 2011 (UTC) == General form of a diagonalizable matrix. == For a 2 x 2 mattrix \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \\ \end{bmatrix} what algebraic criteria in terms of a,b,c,d are necessary and sufficient to ensure that there exists a real matrix P such that P^{-1}\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \\ \end{bmatrix}P is diagonal? What algebraic criteria in terms of a,b,c,d are necessary and sufficient to ensure that there does not exist a real matrix P such that P^{-1}\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \\ \end{bmatrix}P is diagonal but there exists a complex matrix P such that P^{-1}\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \\ \end{bmatrix}P is diagonal?

I can get (a+d)^2 - 4(ad - bc) \ne 0 ensures that the eigenvalues are distinct. This is a sufficient condition to ensure diagonalizability, but not a necessary one. I can not make any further progress.
(a+d)^2 - 4(ad - bc) is the discriminant of the characteristic polynomial.[[User:Widener|Widener]] ([[User talk:Widener|talk]]) 09:15, 10 October 2011 (UTC) :It's fairly simple for the 2x2 case. If the eigenvalues are not distinct, then the matrix is diagonalizable iff it is already diagonal (a=d,\ b=c=0). This is easy to show - if P^{-1}AP=\lambda I then A=P(\lambda I)P^{-1}=\lambda I. In other words, the whole notion of matrix similarity rests on the noncommutativity of multiplication, but scalar matrices behave like scalars and commute. -- [[User:Meni Rosenfeld|Meni Rosenfeld]] ([[User Talk:Meni Rosenfeld|talk]]) 09:36, 10 October 2011 (UTC) ::OK thanks - so if a,b,c,d satisfy (a+d)^2 - 4(ad - bc) \ne 0 OR a=d,\ b=c=0, then this is a necessary and sufficient condition to ensure that A is diagonalizable. However it doesn't answer the question as to under what conditions A is diagonalizable by a real, or nonreal, matrix. Although I suspect replacing (a+d)^2 - 4(ad - bc) \ne 0 with the stronger statement (a+d)^2 - 4(ad - bc) > 0 or (a+d)^2 - 4(ad - bc) < 0 respectively may achieve this, but I'm not sure. After all, is it possible for P to be real even if the eigenvalues are nonreal, or vice versa? [[User:Widener|Widener]] ([[User talk:Widener|talk]]) 10:22, 10 October 2011 (UTC) :::If ''A'' is a real matrix, ''P'' is a complex matrix and P^{-1}AP is a real diagonal matrix then there is also some real matrix Q such that Q^{-1}AQ is diagonal (and also nonreal ones, for example any multiple of ''Q'' by a nonreal scalar). If ''A'' has any nonreal eigenvalue for real ''P'' P^{-1}AP is real and cannot be diagonal. ::: So: If \Delta>0, then ''A'' has two distinct real eigenvalues so it is diagonalizable over the reals; if \Delta=0 then it has a double eigenvalue so it is diagonalizable iff it is diagonal; if \Delta<0 then it has two distinct complex conjugate eigenvalues, so it is diagonalizable with a complex ''P'' but not with a real ''P''. -- [[User:Meni Rosenfeld|Meni Rosenfeld]] ([[User Talk:Meni Rosenfeld|talk]]) 10:48, 10 October 2011 (UTC)

title: User talk:Tractor123456789
content:
== April 2015 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|alt=Information icon]] Hello, I'm [[User:DemocraticLuntz|DemocraticLuntz]]. I wanted to let you know that I undid one or more of [[Special:Contributions/Tractor123456789|your recent contributions]] to [[:Absolute monarchy]] because it did not appear constructive. title: Northbrook College
content:
{{Infobox university |name = Northbrook College Sussex |latin_name = |image_name = Northbrook College, Cecil Pashley Way, Shoreham Airport - geograph.org.uk - 1075018.jpg |image_size = |caption = The college's engineering campus in 2008 |motto = |established = 1986— Northbrook College
1912—West Sussex College of Art & Design |type = Public |endowment = |staff = 1,000[http://www.independent.co.uk/student/into-university/az-uni-colleges/northbrook-college-sussex-459004.html Independent Guide to Northbrook College Sussex] Retrieved on 2011-08-03. |faculty = |chancellor = |vice_chancellor = |head_label = |head = |students = 16,000 |undergrad = |postgrad = |city = [[Worthing]] |state = |country = [[England]], [[United Kingdom]] |campus = |colours = |mascot = |nickname = |affiliations = [[University of Brighton]] |footnotes = |website = http://www.northbrook.ac.uk |logo = }}'''Northbrook College''' is a [[further education]] and [[higher education]] college with 3 campuses in [[Worthing]] and 1 nearby [[Shoreham-by-Sea]] in [[West Sussex]]. It is also the principal provider of work-related further education in the Worthing area. ==Overview== The college's Worthing campuses are the University Centre Worthing in West Durrington, The Broadwater Campus and The Business Development Centre at Liverpool Gardens (Worthing Town). The college's Shoreham campus is at [[Shoreham Airport]]. Northbrook was previously West Sussex College of Design (WSCD) but amalgamated with Worthing Technical College and Chelsea College of Aeronautical and Automobile Engineering in 1985-86. Whilst the college retained its central Worthing site in Union Place, West Sussex County Council (WSCC) closed the workshops in Homefield Place, which were knocked down and are now the [[Environment Agency]] headquarters for the area. The college is the largest provider of [[Higher Education]] for the creative and cultural industries in [[West Sussex]]. It is also a significant provider of Higher Education in a variety of other work-related areas. The College, additionally, has contracts for [[Apprenticeship#United Kingdom|apprenticeship]] training and adult and community learning, and provides courses in most work-related areas as well as those for personal development. It also runs courses at [[HMP Ford]]. The college is also home to the [[Southern Theatre Arts Centre]], providing theatre courses ranging from [[National Diploma (UK)|National Diploma]]s to Foundation Degrees and BA Hons, which like all Northbrook's higher education courses are affiliated with the [[University of Brighton]]. Its venue, The Northbrook Theatre, is a professional theatre that regularly hosts touring companies from around the UK and Europe. Productions in recent years include Wild Party, Chess, [[The Blue Room (play)|The Blue Room]], Angles in America, Metamorphosis and West. ==Campus locations== *University Centre Worthing, Durrington: {{coord|50|49|24.42|N|0|25|56.69|W|type:edu_region:GB}} *Broadwater: {{coord|50|49|29.3|N|0|22|29.05|W|type:edu_region:GB}} *Shoreham Airport: {{coord|50|50|1.31|N|0|17|28.71|W|type:edu_region:GB}} *Business Development Centre at Liverpool Gardens: {{coord|50|48|47|N|0|22|19|W|type:edu_region:GB}} ==Notable alumni== * [[Leo Sayer]], [[singer-songwriter]] and [[musician]] * [[Jamie Hewlett]], [[comic book artist]] and co-creator of the comic ''[[Tank Girl]]'' and co-creator of the [[virtual band]] ''[[Gorillaz]]'' * [[Alan Martin (writer)|Alan Martin]], [[comic book writer]] and co-creator of the comic ''Tank Girl'' * [[Claire Phillips (artist)|Claire Phillips]], British portrait artist * [[Robert Smith (musician)|Robert Smith]], front man and principal songwriter to the band [[The Cure]] * [[Sunset Strippers]], electronic music band * [[Nick Waplington]], artist and photographer * [[Paul Norris (visual effects)|Paul Norris]], Oscar winner in Visual Effects for the film [[Ex Machina (film)]].{{cn|date=March 2016}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.northbrook.ac.uk}} {{Worthing}} {{Universities and colleges in South East England}} {{Schools in West Sussex}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in Worthing]] [[Category:Further education colleges in Sussex]] {{UK-university-stub}}

{{spanish name|Iyanga|Travieso}}
'''Ibán Iyanga Travieso''' (born 2 June 1987), commonly known as '''Randy''', is an Equatoguinean [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for Cypriot club [[Aris Limassol]] as a [[Midfielder#Winger|left winger]] but also as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]].

==Club career==
Born in [[Las Palmas]], [[Canary Islands]], [[Spain]] to an Equatoguinean father and a [[Spanish people|Spanish mother]], Randy made his professional debuts with local [[UD Las Palmas]], playing once for the first team in the [[2008–09 Segunda División|2008–09 season]], as it was in the [[Segunda División|second division]]. He spent the vast majority of his spell, however, mainly associated to the [[UD Las Palmas Atlético|reserve side]].

In the following summer, Randy served a season-long loan at [[CD Mirandés]], in the [[Segunda División B|third level]].<ref>[http://laspalmas.esfutbol.es/noticias/randy-marca-su-primer-gol-con-el-mirandes.html Randy marca su primer gol con el Mirandés (Randy scores first goal for Mirandés)]; esFutbol, 18 November 2009 {{es icon}}</ref> In 2013, after only nine league appearances in two seasons combined and one year with amateurs [[CA Ceuta]], he signed for [[Morocco|Moroccan]] club [[Moghreb Tétouan]];<ref>[http://www.elpueblodeceuta.es/201305097201.html Randy confirma que se irá pase lo que pase con el play off (Randy confirms departure regardless of playoff outcome)]; El Pueblo de Ceuta, 9 May 2013 {{es icon}}</ref> however, shortly after, he asked for the termination of his three-year contract due to personal reasons, and moved to [[Fokikos A.C.]] in the [[Football League (Greece)]].<ref>[http://fokikos.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1735:2013-08-30-15-54-29&catid=14:top-menu Μεταγραφή – φωτιά από τον Φωκικό]; Fokikos' official website, 30 August 2013 {{gr icon}}</ref>

==International career==
In July 2010 Randy received his first call for the [[Equatorial Guinea national football team|Equatoguinean national team]], for a friendly match against [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]] on 11 August.<ref>[http://www.udlaspalmas.net/2010/07/26/randy-convocado-con-guinea-ecuatorial/ Randy, convocado con Guinea Ecuatorial (Randy, called by Equatorial Guinea)]; Las Palmas' official website, 26 July 2010 {{es icon}}</ref> However, he rejected the call to concentrate on club duties with Las Palmas' first team.

Randy's international debut came on 12 October 2010, in a 0–2 friendly loss with [[Botswana national football team|Botswana]] in [[Malabo]].<ref>[http://www.udlaspalmas.es/actualidad-noticias-321 Randy disputó los 90 minutos con Guinea (Randy played 90 minutes with Guinea)]; Las Palmas' official website, 13 October 2010 {{es icon}}</ref>

title: 2002 Ms. Olympia
content:
{{ Infobox MMA event
| name = 2002 Ms. Olympia 
| promotion = [[International Federation of BodyBuilders|IFBB]]
| date = October 18, 2002
| venue = [[Mandalay Bay Arena]]
| city = {{flagicon|USA}} [[Paradise, Nevada]], [[United States]]
| previousevent = [[2001 Ms. Olympia]]
| followingevent = [[2003 Ms. Olympia]]
}}

The '''2002 [[Ms. Olympia]]''' contest 
is an [[International Federation of BodyBuilders|IFBB]] [[professional bodybuilding]] competition and part of '''[[Joe Weider's Olympia Fitness & Performance Weekend]] 2002''' was held on October 18, 2002, at the [[Mandalay Bay Arena]] in [[Paradise, Nevada]]. It was the 23rd Ms. Olympia competition held. Other events at the exhibition include the [[2002 Mr. Olympia|Mr. Olympia]] and [[2002 Fitness Olympia|Fitness Olympia]] contests.<ref name=muscle>{{cite web|title=2002 Ms. Olympia 2002 Mr. Olympia Las Vegas|url=http://www.femalemuscle.com/contests/olympia2002/olympia_2002.html|publisher=femalemuscle.com|accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref><ref name=getbig>{{cite web|title=Ms. Olympia Contest Results|url=http://www.getbig.com/results/e-msoly.htm|publisher=getbig.com|accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref><ref name=ifbb>{{cite web|title=Competitor History of the Ms. Olympia|url=http://www.ifbbpro.com/history-of-the-mr-olympia/competitor-history-of-the-ms-olympia/|publisher=ifbbpro.com|accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref><ref name=ironman>{{cite web|title=http://www.ironmanmagazine.com/2002-ms-olympia-lendas-back-in-town/|url=http://www.ironmanmagazine.com/2002-ms-olympia-lendas-back-in-town/|publisher=ironmanmagazine.com|accessdate=23 November 2013}}</ref>

==Attended==
*13th Ms. Olympia attended - Laura Creavalle
*9th Ms. Olympia attended - Lenda Murray
*7th Ms. Olympia attended - Vickie Gates
*6th Ms. Olympia attended - Juliette Bergmann
*5th Ms. Olympia attended - Valentina Chepiga, Nancy Lewis, and Yaxeni Oriquen-Garcia
*4th Ms. Olympia attended - Iris Kyle
*3rd Ms. Olympia attended - Dayana Cadeau
*2nd Ms. Olympia attended - Fannie Barrios and Angela DeBatin
*1st Ms. Olympia attended - Sophie Duquette, Susanne Niederhauser, Beth Roberts, and Betty Viana
*Previous year Olympia attendees who did not attend – [[Renee Casella]], [[Kim Harris]], [[Lesa Lewis]], [[Gayle Moher]], [[Betty Pariso]], [[Brenda Raganot]], and [[Joanna Thomas]]

==Notable Events==
* Lenda Murray comes back after a four year hiatus to win her 7th overall and heavyweight Ms. Olympia title, thus surpassing [[Cory Everson]]'s six overall Olympia wins.  Juliette Bergmann wins her 2nd lightweight Ms. Olympia title.

* This was Laura Creavalle last Olympia before her retirement.

title: User talk:86.178.78.174
content:
'''Welcome!''' Hello, 86.178.78.174, and [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/86.178.78.174|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages that you might find helpful: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Help:Editing|How to edit a page]] and [[Wikipedia:Article development|How to develop articles]] *[[Wikipedia:Your first article|How to create your first article]] (using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard|Article Wizard]] if you wish) *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign]] your messages on [[Help:Using talk pages|discussion page]]s using four [[tilde]]s (~~~~); this will automatically insert your username and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on my talk page, or ask your question on this page and then place {{help me}} before the question. Again, welcome! [[Image:Stop hand nuvola.svg|30px|left|alt=|link=]] Your recent edits seem to have the appearance of [[Wikipedia:Edit warring|edit warring]] after a review of the reverts you have made on [[:Dalai Lama]]. Users are expected to [[Wikipedia:Consensus#Consensus-building in talk pages|collaborate and discuss]] with others and avoid editing [[Wikipedia:Disruptive editing|disruptively]].
Please be particularly aware, the [[Wikipedia:Edit warring#The three-revert rule|three-revert rule]] states that: # '''Making more than three reversions on a single page within a 24-hour period is almost always grounds for an immediate block.''' # '''Do not edit war even if you believe you are right.''' If you find yourself in an editing dispute, use the article's [[Wikipedia:Talk page guidelines|talk page]] to discuss the changes; work towards a version that represents [[Wikipedia:Consensus|consensus]] among editors. You can post a request for help at an [[Wikipedia:Noticeboards|appropriate noticeboard]] or seek [[Wikipedia:Dispute resolution|dispute resolution]]. In some cases it may be appropriate to request temporary [[Wikipedia:Protection policy|page protection]]. If you engage in an edit war, you '''may be [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]] from editing without further notice.''' [[User:AV3000|AV3000]] ([[User talk:AV3000|talk]]) 13:58, 29 August 2011 (UTC)

title: User talk:153.221.40.138
content: ==Welcome== Hello, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Someone using this [[IP address]], 153.221.40.138, made test edits on the page [[:Everest (2015 film)]] which have been [[Help:Reverting|reverted]] or removed. If you did this, please use [[Wikipedia:Sandbox|the sandbox]] for any other tests you may want to do. If 153.221.40.138 is a [[Network address translation|shared IP address]] and you did not do this, you may wish to consider [{{fullurl:Special:Userlogin|type=signup&returnto=Main_Page}} getting a username] to avoid confusion with other editors and further irrelevant notices. Here are a few good links for newcomers: *'''[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]]''' *'''[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]]''' *'''[[Wikipedia:Your first article|Tips on starting your first article]]''' *'''[[Help:Contents|Help pages]]''' *'''[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]]''' Here are some other hints and tips: * I recommend that you get a username. You don't have to log in to read or edit articles on Wikipedia, but '''[{{fullurl:Special:Userlogin|type=signup&campaign=anonwelcometemplate}} creating an account]''' is quick, free and non-intrusive, requires no personal information, and there are many [[Wikipedia:Why create an account?|benefits of having a username]]. (If you edit without a username, your [[IP address]] is used to identify you instead.) * When using [[Wikipedia:talk pages|talk pages]], please [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] at the end of your messages by typing four tildes (~~~~). This will automatically produce your username (or IP address) and the date. I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! If you need [[Wikipedia:Help|help]], check out [[Wikipedia:Where to ask a question]], ask me on [[User talk:Robvanvee|my talk page]], or type {{[[:Category:Wikipedians looking for help|helpme]]}} here on ''your'' talk page and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Again, welcome! [[User:Robvanvee|Rob]][[User talk:Robvanvee|van]][[Special:Contributions/Robvanvee|vee]] 14:10, 27 September 2015 (UTC)

content:
== Welcome == {| style="background-color:#F5FFFA; padding:0;" cellpadding="0" |class="MainPageBG" style="border:1px solid lightgrey; background-color:lightgrey; vertical-align:top; color:#000000; font-size:85%"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:lavender; padding:0;" !
Hello, Himesh84! '''[[Wikipedia:Introduction|Welcome]] to Wikipedia!''' Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/Himesh84|your contributions]]. You may benefit from following some of the links below, which will help you get the most out of Wikipedia. If you have any questions you can ask me on my talk page, or place '''{{helpme}}''' on your [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] and ask your question there. Please remember to [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your name]] on talk pages by clicking [[File:Insert-signature.png|link=Wikipedia:How to sign your posts|alt=]] or by typing four tildes "~~~~"; this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you are already excited about Wikipedia, you might want to consider being "[[Wikipedia:Adopt-a-user|adopted]]" by a more experienced editor or joining a [[Wikipedia:WikiProject|WikiProject]] to collaborate with others in creating and improving articles of your interest. Click [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Council/Directory|here]] for a directory of all the WikiProjects. Finally, please do your best to always fill in the [[Help:Edit summary|edit summary]] field when making edits to pages. Happy editing! [[User:Aboutmovies|Aboutmovies]] ([[User talk:Aboutmovies|talk]]) 07:47, 20 May 2012 (UTC) |} {| width="100%" style="background-color:white;" |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid white; background-color:lightgrey; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:Lavender" !

* [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] • [[Wikipedia:Edit warring#The three-revert rule|Three-revert rule]] • [[Wikipedia:Sock puppetry|Sock puppetry]] * [[Wikipedia:Copyrights|Copyrights]] • [[Wikipedia:Non-free content|Policy for non-free content]] • [[Wikipedia:Image use policy|Image use policy]] * [[Wikipedia:External links|External links]] • [[Wikipedia:Spam|Spam]] • [[Wikipedia:Vandalism|Vandalism]] * [[Wikipedia:Deletion policy|Deletion policy]] • [[Wikipedia:Conflict of interest|Conflict of interest]] • [[Wikipedia:Notability|Notability]] |- |} |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid lightgrey; background-color:Seashell; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:Seashell" !

Miscellaneous

You may prevent the proposed deletion by removing the {{Tlc|proposed deletion/dated}} notice, but please explain why in your [[Help:edit summary|edit summary]] or on [[Talk:Vanni forest|the article's talk page]]. Please consider improving the article to address the issues raised. Removing {{Tlc|proposed deletion/dated}} will stop the [[Wikipedia:Proposed deletion|proposed deletion process]], but other [[Wikipedia:deletion process|deletion process]]es exist. In particular, the [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|speedy deletion]] process can result in deletion without discussion, and [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion|articles for deletion]] allows discussion to reach [[Wikipedia:Consensus|consensus]] for deletion. [[User:Obi2canibe|obi2canibe]][[User_talk:Obi2canibe|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Obi2canibe|contr]] 16:52, 20 May 2012 (UTC) == May 2012 == [[Image:Information.svg|25px|alt=|link=]] Welcome to Wikipedia. Everyone is welcome to contribute to the encyclopedia, but when you add or change content, as you did to the article [[:Rajarata]], please cite a [[Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources|reliable source]] for your addition. This helps maintain our policy of [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiability]]. See [[Wikipedia:Citing sources]] for how to cite sources, and the [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome page]] to learn more about contributing to this encyclopedia. Thank you. [[User:Obi2canibe|obi2canibe]][[User_talk:Obi2canibe|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Obi2canibe|contr]] 16:53, 20 May 2012 (UTC) == [[Sri Lanka]] == Hi. If you believe there are errors in [[Prehistory of Sri Lanka]], then please either correct them (with reliable sources to support your corrections), or discuss the errors at [[Talk:Prehistory of Sri Lanka]] - do not just remove links to the article from other articles. -- [[User:Boing! said Zebedee|Boing! said Zebedee]] ([[User talk:Boing! said Zebedee|talk]]) 08:13, 5 June 2012 (UTC) == [[Naga people (Sri Lanka)]] == Considering the material you removed from [[Naga people (Sri Lanka)]], it appears to be sourced, so I think we'd need more than just your word for it that it is "unrelated/sceintically not proved" - please discuss it at the article's Talk page and gain a consensus for its removal. Also, the material you added was unsourced, so we would need a source for it - just saying "It is evident that..." is not sufficient. -- [[User:Boing! said Zebedee|Boing! said Zebedee]] ([[User talk:Boing! said Zebedee|talk]]) 08:16, 5 June 2012 (UTC) == June 2012 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|alt=|link=]] [[Wikipedia:Introduction|Welcome]] to Wikipedia, and thank you for [[Special:Contributions/Himesh84|your contributions]]. One of the [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|core policies]] of Wikipedia is that articles should always be written from a [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|neutral point of view]]. A contribution you made to [[History of Sri Lanka]] appears to carry a non-neutral point of view, and your edit may have been changed or reverted to correct the problem. Please remember to observe this. Thank you. [[User:Jsorens|Jsorens]] ([[User talk:Jsorens|talk]]) 13:45, 7 June 2012 (UTC) ==[[:Kingdom of Rajarata]]== [[Image:Ambox warning pn.svg|left|40px|alt=|link=]] This is an automated message from [[User:MadmanBot|MadmanBot]]. I have performed a search with the contents of [[:Kingdom of Rajarata]], and it appears to be very similar to another Wikipedia page: [[:Rajarata]]. It is possible that you have accidentally duplicated contents, or made an error while creating the page— you might want to look at the pages and see if that is the case. If you are intentionally trying to rename an article, please see [[Help:Moving a page]] for instructions on how to do this without copying and pasting. If you are trying to move or copy content from one article to a different one, please see [[Wikipedia:Copying within Wikipedia]] and be sure you have acknowledged the duplication of material in an [[Help:edit summary|edit summary]] to preserve attribution history. It is possible that the bot is confused and found similarity where none actually exists. If that is the case, you can remove the tag from the article. [[User:MadmanBot|MadmanBot]] ([[User talk:MadmanBot|talk]]) 07:19, 13 June 2012 (UTC) ==Disambiguation link notification for June 28== Hi. == Nomination of [[Ethnic Conflict in Sri Lanka]] for deletion ==
[[File:Ambox warning orange.svg|42px|alt=|link=]]
A discussion is taking place as to whether the article '''[[Ethnic Conflict in Sri Lanka]]''' is suitable for inclusion in Wikipedia according to [[Wikipedia:List of policies and guidelines|Wikipedia's policies and guidelines]] or whether it should be [[Wikipedia:Deletion policy|deleted]]. The article will be discussed at [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Ethnic Conflict in Sri Lanka ]] until a consensus is reached, and anyone is welcome to contribute to the discussion. The nomination will explain the policies and guidelines which are of concern. The discussion focuses on high-quality evidence and our policies and guidelines. Users may edit the article during the discussion, including to improve the article to address concerns raised in the discussion. However, do not remove the article-for-deletion template from the top of the article. Note that you need to change your password '''''after''''' transitioning to the secure server; if you change your password first, while still using the regular ('''http''') server, someone could potentially see it in unencrypted traffic during the short window of time before you switch over to using the secure server. — [[User:Richwales|Rich]][[User talk:Richwales|wales]] ''(no relation to Jimbo)'' 19:03, 29 January 2013 (UTC) 23:40, 29 January 2013 (UTC) ::: It is working. This applies to user talk pages (see my user talk page, for example, and note how "wales" shows up as '''wales''' instead of [[User talk:Richwales|wales]]) — and it also applies to regular articles (e.g., if a page contains a wikilink that points back to the same page). To fully test your signature, try it out on a page other than your own talk page. — [[User:Richwales|Rich]][[User talk:Richwales|wales]] ''(no relation to Jimbo)'' 07:52, 30 January 2013 (UTC) ::::: I have tested it in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Vanni_forest#Signature_testings here]. In case you didn't know, when you add content to [[Wikipedia:Talk page|talk pages]] and Wikipedia pages that have open discussion, you should [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your posts]] by typing four [[tilde]]s ( ~~~~ ) at the end of your comment. You could also click on the signature button [[File:Insert-signature.png|link=Wikipedia:How to sign your posts]] or [[File:Signature icon.png|link=Wikipedia:How to sign your posts]] located above the edit window. This will automatically insert a signature with your username or IP address and the time you posted the comment. This information is useful because other editors will be able to tell who said what, and when they said it. Thank you. --[[User:SineBot|SineBot]] ([[User talk:SineBot|talk]]) 09:11, 30 January 2013 (UTC) ==ANI== Hello. title: Siege of Shkodra (1474)
content:
{{Other uses|Siege of Shkodër (disambiguation){{!}}Siege of Shkodër}} {{infobox military conflict | conflict = Siege of Shkodra | partof = | image = | caption = | date = Spring 1474 — 8 August 1474 | place = [[Shkodër]], [[Albania Veneta]] | coordinates = {{coord|42.0465|19.4935|region:AL-SH|display=title,inline}} | map_type = | map_relief = | latitude = | longitude = | map_size = | map_marksize = | map_caption = | map_label = | territory = | result = Victory of Venice and Zeta | status = | combatant1 = {{flagicon|Ottoman Empire|1383}} [[Ottoman Empire]] | combatant2 = {{flag|Republic of Venice}}
[[Albanians|Albanian]] resistance forces [[File:Coat of arms of the house of Crnojevic.svg|18px]] [[Zeta under the Crnojevići|Lordship of Zeta]] | commander1 = [[Hadım Suleiman Pasha (governor of Rumelia)|Hadım Suleiman Pasha]] | commander2 = [[Antonio Loredan]]
[[Pietro Mocenigo]]
[[Triadan Gritti]]
Leonardo Boldu ---- [[Ivan Crnojević]] | commander3 = | units1 = | units2 = | units3 = | strength1 = 50,000 | strength2 = 25.000 | strength3 = | casualties1 = 7,000–20,000 Ottoman soldiers killedMerula, George. “The War of Shkodra” (1474). An English translation by Robert Elsie at [http://www.albanianhistory.net/texts15/AH1474.html www.albanianhistory.net/texts15/AH1474.html] | casualties2 = unknown number of soldiers and 3,000 civilians from Scutari (primary source) | casualties3 = | notes = | campaignbox = }} {{Ottoman-Albanian Wars}} The '''Siege of Shkodra''' of 1474 was an [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] attack upon [[Venetian Republic|Venetian]]-controlled [[Shkodër|Shkodra]] in [[Albania Veneta]] during the [[Ottoman-Venetian War (1463-1479)|First Ottoman-Venetian War]] (1463–79). == Siege == Strong Ottoman forces besieged Shkodra in spring 1474.{{harvnb|Srejović|1981|p=406}}{{quote| Ништа се није могло остварити јер је снажна турска војска с пролећа 1474 притисла Скадар.}} Mehmed had dispatched the governor of [[Rûm Eyalet|Rumelia]], [[Hadım Suleiman Pasha (governor of Rumelia)|Hadım Suleiman Pasha]], with about 8,000 men, but were repulsed by commander [[Antonio Loredan]] and feared Venetian reinforcements.{{harvnb|Srejović|1981|p=406}}{{quote| Румелијски беглербег Сулејман је почео опсаду са око 8.000 људи.}}Jaques, Tony. ''Dictionary of Battles and Sieges''. Westport, CT: Greenwood Press, 2007, p. 921 According to some sources, when Scutari garrison complained for lack of food and water, Loredan told them ''"If you are hungry, here is my flesh; if you are thirsty, I give you my blood."''{{cite book|author=C. Marshall Smith|title=The Seven Ages of Venice: A Romantic Rendering of Venetian History|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=pHVoAAAAMAAJ|year=1927|publisher=Blackie & son, limited|page=134|quote= " If you are hungry, here is my flesh; if you are thirsty, I give you my blood."}} The [[Venetian Senate]] ordered all available galleys to transport archers to Shkodra trough river [[Bojana (river)|Bojana]].{{citation needed|date=September 2012}} All Venetian governors were ordered to help besieged city.{{citation needed|date=September 2012}} According to Venetian reports in July Shkodra was besieged by 50,000 Ottoman soldiers who were supported by heavy artillery.{{citation needed|date=September 2012}} At the beginning of 1474 the whole region around Shkodra, including the abandoned [[Baleč]], came under [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman rule]].{{citation needed|date=September 2012}} According to some sources the Ottoman sultan had intentions to rebuild [[Podgorica]] and Baleč in 1474 and to settle them with 5,000 Turkish families in order to establish an additional obstacle for cooperation of [[Lordship of Zeta under the Crnojevići|Crnojević's Zeta]] and besieged [[Albania Veneta|Venetian Shkodra]].{{Citation |last=Božić |first= Ivan |title= Nemirno pomorje XV veka |url=http://books.google.rs/books?id=X2AeAAAAMAAJ&q=%D0%91%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%87&dq=%D0%91%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%87&hl=en&sa=X&ei=Eu0aT6bsLe_E4gSixvjuDQ&redir_esc=y |year=1979 |publisher=Srpska književna zadruga |location=Beograd |language= Serbian |oclc=5845972 |doi= |doi_inactivedate= |bibcode= |id= |page=295 |quote= почетком 1474 ... о султановој намери да обнови Подгорицу и да је насели са пет хиљада турских домаћинстава, а исто тако да подигне из рушевина стари град Балеч}}{{cite book|last=Ćorović|first=Vladimir|title=Istorija Srba|year=2005|publisher=Zoograf|url=http://books.google.rs/books?id=IGotAQAAIAAJ&q=%D0%91%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%87&dq=%D0%91%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%87&hl=en&sa=X&ei=XC4bT-boOvP54QTmlrmEDQ&redir_esc=y|accessdate=21 January 2012|page=357|language=Serbian|quote=...очвидно из разлога да спрече везе између Зећана и Албанаца}} During their 1474 campaign Ottomans damaged Alessio and razed [[Dagnum]] castle.{{Citation |last=Božić |first= Ivan|title= Nemirno pomorje XV veka |url=http://books.google.rs/books?hl=sr&id=SnkBAAAAMAAJ&q=%D0%BE%D1%84%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B7%D0%B8%D0%B2%D0%B5+#search_anchor |year=1979 |publisher=Srpska književna zadruga |location=Beograd |language= Serbian |oclc=5845972 |doi= |doi_inactivedate= |bibcode= |id= |page=383 |quote=Турци су предузели две одлучне офанзиве - 1474 и 1478. У првом походу порушили су Дањ, око кога су се толико отимали Дукађини, а онда га напустили. Многобројне поправке су биле потребне у Љешу.}} [[Triadan Gritti]] was appointed as Venetian [[captain general]] instead of [[Pietro Mocenigo]]. Gritti led the Venetian fleet of six galleys which sailed early in May 1474 to protect the coast of Albania Veneta and especially the mouths of river Bojana.{{Citation|last=Babinger|first=Franz|title=Mehmed the Conqueror and His Time|url=http://books.google.rs/books?id=PPxC6rO7vvsC&pg=PA334&dq=Triadan+Gritti&hl=en&sa=X&ei=8CiQT7CsCoiq-ga3l7iBBA&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=Triadan%20Gritti&f=false |quote= |year=1992|page=334|publisher=Princeton University Press|isbn=9780691010786}} When Venetian fleet entered Bojana the Ottoman forces attempted to block it by clogging the mouth of Bojana with a cut tree trunks, just like [[Serbian Despotate|Serbian]] voivode [[Voivode Mazarek|Mazarek]] did during [[Second Scutari War]]. Gritti returned his fleet down the river and destroyed Ottoman forces on 15 June 1474.{{harvnb|Božić|1979|p=380}}{{quote|У близиниушћа покушали су да затворе реку, као што je 1422. годинечинио и деспотов командант Мазарек. Једноставно су насе-кли дрвеће и побацали га у реку да би затворили излаз. Три-јадан Грити није смео дозволити да му непријатељ блокирафлоту у реци}} Despite all of his efforts, Gritti was not able to deliver to Scutari all goods his fleet carried because many of his ships were trapped in the shallow waters of Bojana near [[Sveti Srđ]].{{harvnb|Božić|1979|p=380}}{{quote|ни Тријадан Грити није могао опседнутом граду дапошаље помоћ којом су били натоварени бродови укотвљенипод Светим Срђом}} When Gritti joined Mocenigo in Shkodra and they both ordered to [[Leonardo Boldu]] to find [[Ivan Crnojević]] and to urge him to mobilize as many of his men as possible to help Venetians during the [[Siege of Shkodra]]. Boldu was also ordered to transport Crnojević's cavalry and infantry over the [[Skadar Lake]].{{Citation |last=Imber |first= Colin |title=The Ottoman Empire, 1300-1481 |url=http://books.google.rs/books?ei=F_mwT7PGPIXctAaU6by-Bg&id=lIppAAAAMAAJ&dq=triadan+gritti&q=%22Triadan+Gritti%22#search_anchor |year=1990 |month= |publisher=Isis Press |location= Istanbul|isbn=9789754280159 |oclc=22297448 |page=219 |quote=When the commanders of the fleet — Triadan Gritti and his predecessor as Captain-General, Piero Moccnigo — met in Albania, they commissioned a certain Leonardo Boldu to find one of the lords of the country to the north of Lake Shkoder, John Chcrnojcvich, "a man of great following and authority," and exhort him to gather as many men as possible. They ordered Leonardo to transport these, with his own infantry and cavalry, across the lake to relieve Shkoder,...}} [[Ivan Crnojević]] had important role in the defense of the Shkodra because he provided connection with Kotor and supplied the city trough [[Žabljak Crnojevića|Žabljak]] or [[Skadar Lake]], fighting simultaneously against strong Ottoman forces.{{Citation |last= Maletić |first= Mihailo |title= Crna Gora |trans_title= Montenegro |url=http://books.google.rs/books?ei=mG0uUN7YPI_64QSfzoHIAg&hl=sr&id=03sBAAAAMAAJ&dq=%D0%B8%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BD+%D1%86%D1%80%D0%BD%D0%BE%D1%98%D0%B5%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%9B+%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80&q=1478+%D0%B8%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BD#search_anchor |year= 1976 |month= |publisher= Književne novine |location= Belgrade |language= Serbian |isbn= |oclc=5090762 |page=172 |quote= У одбрани Скадра важну улогу играо је Иван Црнојевић обезбијеђујући везу с Котором и дотурање помоћи преко Жабљака и Скадарског језера. Морао је да одбија нападе великих турских одреда. |laysummary= |laydate= |postscript= |lastauthoramp= |ref= }} He transported men and woods from [[Kotor]] over the hills into Žabljak where he built [[fusta]]s which surprised Ottomans at Skadar lake.{{harvnb|Srejović|1981|p=406}}{{quote|Преко Котора је брдским путевима пребацивао људе и грађу од које би се, кад стигне у Жабљак, изградиле фусте и изненадили Турци на Скадарском језеру.}} During whole summer Ivan Crnojević participated in military actions. He controlled the Skadar lake with three fustas and 15 smaller ships, which was very important because Venetian fleet (composed of 34 larger ships and about 100 smaller) was unable to sail further than [[Sveti Srđ]].{{harvnb|Srejović|1981|p=407}}{{quote|Иван Црнојевић је господарио Скадарским језером уз помоћ три фусте и 15 мањих бродова. То је било веома значајно, јер велика млетачка флота није могла да се пробија дал.е од Светог Срђа}} Boldu was able to reach the besieged city from Žabljak thanks to the ships of Ivan Crnojević.{{cite book|author=Dinko Franetović-Bûre|title=Historija pomorstva i ribarstva Crne Gore do 1918 godine|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=wU8aAAAAIAAJ|accessdate=24 April 2013|year=1960|publisher=s.n.|page=82|quote=...su Turci opsjedali Skadar 1474, Leonardo Boldu, Mleča- nin, je na burćima i lađama Ivana Crnojevića iz Zabljaka mogao s vojskom da dođe pod grad.}} The crew of Venetian ships together with [[stratioti]] from Greece joined the defenders in the besieged city and, according to some Venetian reports, their total number reached 25,000.{{harvnb|Srejović|1981|p=407}}{{quote|мада су им се касније прикључили стратиоти из Грчке као и посаде свих бродова, млетачке снаге ни у једном тренутку нису премашиле 25.000 људи, како су Млечани извештавали своје савезнике}} After the discovery of the treason committed by Andreas Humoj, a member of [[Humoj family]], during the [[Siege of Shkodra]] Gritti sentenced him to death and had him executed by a man from [[Tuzi]].{{Citation |last=Schmitt |first=Oliver Jens |authorlink=Oliver Jens Schmitt |title=Das venezianische Albanien (1392-1479) |url=http://books.google.rs/books?id=eKKS3u7iPWcC&pg=PA490&dq=%22ben+Koja+hatten%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=wLUjT6SGIdCk-gb4oq22CA&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22ben%20Koja%20hatten%22&f=false |year=2001 |month= |publisher=R. Oldenbourg Verlag GmbH München |location= München|language= |isbn=3-486-56569--9 |page=492 |quote= Rätselhaft erscheint vor diesem Hintergrund das Schicksal Andreas Humojs: Er beging verrat und wurde von Generalkapitan Triadan Gritti zum tode verurteilt. Das urteil vollstreckte ein Tuzi.}} Between 7,000 and 20,000 Ottoman soldiers are reported to have been killed, and approximately 3,000 civilians from Scutari died of thirst and hunger. In the siege, the outer walls were damaged significantly. The citizens rebuilt the walls in anticipation of a stronger Ottoman attack later. The Ottomans did [[Siege of Shkodra|return in 1478]] to conquer Shkodra. == References == {{Reflist|2}} == Sources == ===Primary=== * [[Marin Barleti|Barletius, Marinus]]. ''De obsidione Scodrensi'' [The Siege of Shkodra]. Venice: B. de Vitalibus, 1504. * A. Pashazade, Tursun, Bidlisi, K. Pashazade, Kivami, et al., in Pulaha, Selami (ed.). ''[http://books.google.com/books?id=1cL-cQAACAAJ&dq=inauthor:%22Selami+Pulaha%22&source=bl&ots=KFEBeON3_H&sig=K8l73--6i0VX4iqRdhhwA_MNAF8&hl=en&sa=X&ei=UMZHUN2zAo_34QS1zYCgCA&ved=0CF8Q6AEwCQ Lufta shqiptaro-turke në shekullin XV: Burime osmane]'' [Albanian-Turkish Wars in the Fifteenth Century: Ottoman Sources] (a compendium of Ottoman chronicles in both the original languages and Albanian translations). Tiranë: Universiteti Shtetëror i Tiranës, Instituti i Historisë dhe Gjuhësisë, 1968. ===Secondary=== {{refbegin}} *{{cite book|last=Babinger|first=Franz.|authorlink=Franz Babinger|title=Mehmed the Conqueror|location=New Jersey|publisher=Princeton University Press|year=1992|isbn=978-0-691-01078-6|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=PPxC6rO7vvsC&printsec=frontcover&dq=Mehmed+the+conqueror&hl=en&sa=X&ei=ArIeT5uePITHtAaT9Ym1DA&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=Mehmed%20the%20conqueror&f=false|ref=harv}} *{{cite book|last=Pulaha|first=Selami.|title=''[http://www.worldcat.org/title/lufta-shqiptaro-turke-ne-shekullin-xv-burime-osmane/oclc/015301329 Lufta shqiptaro-turke në shekullin XV. Burime Osmane]'' [Albanian-Turkish Wars in the Fifteenth Century: Ottoman Sources]|location=Tirana|publisher=Universiteti Shtetëror|year=1968}} * {{Citation |last=Srejović |first= Dragoslav |authorlink=Dragoslav Srejović |title= Istorija srpskog naroda. Knj. 1, Od najstarijih vremena do maričke bitke (1371) |trans_title= History of Serbs, Book 1, From earliest times to Battle of Marica (1371) |url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/istorija-srpskog-naroda-knj-1-od-najstarijih-vremena-do-maricke-bitke-1371/oclc/456125379&referer=brief_results |year= 1981 |publisher= Srpska književna zadruga |location= Belgrade |language= Serbian |isbn= |oclc=456125379 |ref=harv }} * {{Citation |last=Božić |first=Ivan|authorlink=Ivan Božić (historian) |title=Nemirno pomorje XV veka |url=http://books.google.rs/books?id=SnkBAAAAMAAJ&q=%22%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%B2%D0%BB%D0%B5+%D0%B4%D1%83%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%92%D0%B8%D0%BD%22&dq=%22%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%B2%D0%BB%D0%B5+%D0%B4%D1%83%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%92%D0%B8%D0%BD%22&hl=sr&sa=X&ei=l4tmT5OxK5HLsgaY4vT0Aw&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAA |year=1979 |publisher=Srpska književna zadruga |location=Beograd |language=Serbian |oclc=5845972|ref=harv}} == External links == * [http://www.albanianhistory.net/en/texts1000-1799/AH1474.html George Merula ''The Siege of Shkodra'' (1474)] - published on the website of [[Robert Elsie]] [[Category:Ottoman–Venetian Wars]] [[Category:1474 in Europe]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1474]] [[Category:History of Shkodër]] [[Category:15th century in the Ottoman Empire]] [[Category:1474 in the Ottoman Empire]]

title: User talk:Aljedei

==[[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|Speedy deletion]] nomination of [[:International Turnkey Systems]]== [[Image:Ambox warning pn.svg|48px|left|alt=|link=]] {{Quote box|quote=

If this is the first article that you have created, you may want to read [[WP:Your first article|the guide to writing your first article]].

You may want to consider using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard|Article Wizard]] to help you create articles.

|width=20%|align=right}} A tag has been placed on [[:International Turnkey Systems]], requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#G11|section G11 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because the page seems to be unambiguous advertising which only promotes a company, product, group, service or person and would need to be fundamentally rewritten in order to become an encyclopedia article. Please read [[Wikipedia:Spam|the guidelines on spam]] and [[Wikipedia:FAQ/Business]] for more information. If you think that this notice was placed here in error, contest the deletion by clicking on the button labelled "Click here to contest this speedy deletion," which appears inside of the speedy deletion ({{db-...}}) tag (if no such tag exists, the page is no longer a speedy delete candidate). Doing so will take you to the talk page where you will find a pre-formatted place for you to explain why you believe the page should not be deleted. You can also visit the '''[[Talk:International Turnkey Systems|the page's talk page directly]]''' to give your reasons, but be aware that once tagged for ''speedy'' deletion, if the page meets the criterion, it may be deleted without delay. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but don't hesitate to add information to the page that would render it more in conformance with Wikipedia's policies and guidelines. If the page is deleted, you can contact [[:Category:Wikipedia administrators who will provide copies of deleted articles|one of these administrators]] to request that the administrator [[Wikipedia:Userfication#Userfication_of_deleted_content|userfy]] the page or email a copy to you. [[User:Inks.LWC|Inks.LWC]] ([[User talk:Inks.LWC|talk]]) 08:50, 22 June 2011 (UTC) ==License tagging for File:Its.png== Thanks for uploading [[:File:Its.png]]. You don't seem to have indicated the license status of the image. Wikipedia uses a set of [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags|image copyright tags]] to indicate this information. To add a tag to the image, select the appropriate tag from [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags/All|this list]], click on [[:File:Its.png|this link]], then click "Edit this page" and add the tag to the image's description. If there doesn't seem to be a suitable tag, the image is probably not appropriate for use on Wikipedia. For help in choosing the correct tag, or for any other questions, leave a message on [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions]]. Thank you for your cooperation. --[[User:ImageTaggingBot|ImageTaggingBot]] ([[User talk:ImageTaggingBot|talk]]) 11:05, 22 June 2011 (UTC) ==[[:International Turnkey Systems]]== [[Image:Copyright-problem.svg|left|40px|alt=|link=]] This is an automated message from [[User:CorenSearchBot|CorenSearchBot]]. I have performed a web search with the contents of [[:International Turnkey Systems]], and it appears to include material copied directly from http://itsolutions.rozee.pk. It is possible that the bot is confused and found similarity where none actually exists. If that is the case, you can remove the tag from the article. The article will be reviewed to determine if there are any copyright issues. If substantial content is duplicated and it is not [[Wikipedia:Public domain|public domain]] or available under a compatible license, it will be deleted. For legal reasons, we cannot accept copyrighted text or images borrowed from other web sites or printed material. You may use such publications as a source of information, but not as a source of sentences. See our [[Wikipedia:Copyrights|copyright policy]] for further details. (If you own the copyright to the previously published content and wish to donate it, see [[Wikipedia:Donating copyrighted materials]] for the procedure.) [[User:CorenSearchBot|CorenSearchBot]] ([[User talk:CorenSearchBot|talk]]) 07:36, 23 June 2011 (UTC) ==[[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|Speedy deletion]] nomination of [[:International Turnkey Systems]]== [[Image:Ambox warning pn.svg|48px|left|alt=|link=]] A tag has been placed on [[:International Turnkey Systems]], requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia for multiple reasons. '''Please see the page to see the reasons'''. If the page has since been deleted, you can ask me the reasons by leaving a message on [[User talk:Belovedfreak|my user talk page]]. If you think that this notice was placed here in error, contest the deletion by clicking on the button labelled "Click here to contest this speedy deletion," which appears inside of the speedy deletion ({{db-...}}) tag (if no such tag exists, the page is no longer a speedy delete candidate). Doing so will take you to the talk page where you will find a pre-formatted place for you to explain why you believe the page should not be deleted. You can also visit the '''[[Talk:International Turnkey Systems|the page's talk page directly]]''' to give your reasons, but be aware that once tagged for ''speedy'' deletion, if the page meets the criterion, it may be deleted without delay. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but don't hesitate to add information to the page that would render it more in conformance with Wikipedia's policies and guidelines. If the page is deleted, you can contact [[:Category:Wikipedia administrators who will provide copies of deleted articles|one of these administrators]] to request that the administrator [[Wikipedia:Userfication#Userfication_of_deleted_content|userfy]] the page or email a copy to you. [[User:Belovedfreak|Beloved]][[User talk:Belovedfreak|Freak]] 07:59, 23 June 2011 (UTC) == June 2011 == [[Image:Information.svg|25px|alt=|link=]] Welcome to Wikipedia. Everyone is welcome to contribute constructively to the encyclopedia. However, please do not add promotional material to articles or other Wikipedia pages, as you did to [[:International Turnkey Systems]]. [[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not#Wikipedia is not a soapbox|Advertising]] and using Wikipedia as a "[[soapbox]]" are against Wikipedia policy and not permitted. Take a look at the [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome page]] to learn more about Wikipedia. Thank you.[[Category:User talk pages with Uw-advert1 notices|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[User:Belovedfreak|Beloved]][[User talk:Belovedfreak|Freak]] 08:04, 23 June 2011 (UTC) ==File source and copyright licensing problem with File:Its.png== [[File:Copyright-problem.svg|64px|left|File Copyright problem|link=]] Thanks for uploading '''[[:File:Its.png]]'''. However, it currently is missing information on its '''copyright''' status and its '''source'''. Wikipedia takes [[Wikipedia:Copyrights|copyright]] very seriously. If you did not create this work entirely yourself, you will need to specify the owner of the copyright. If you obtained it from a website, please add a link to the page from which it was taken, together with a brief restatement of the website's terms of use of its content. If the original copyright holder is a party unaffiliated with the website, that author should also be credited. You will also need to state under what licensing terms it was released. Please refer to the '''[[WP:IUP#Adding images|image use policy]]''' to learn what files you can or cannot upload on Wikipedia. The page on '''[[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags|copyright tags]]''' may help you to find the correct tag to use for your file. Please add this information by editing the [[:File:Its.png|image description page]]. If the necessary information is not added within the next days, the image will be deleted. If the file is already gone, you can still make a [[Wikipedia:Requests for undeletion|request for undeletion]] and ask for a chance to fix the problem. Please also check any other files you may have uploaded to make sure they are correctly tagged. Here is [{{fullurl:Special:Log|type=upload&user=Aljedei}} a list of your uploads]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you. [[User:AllyD|AllyD]] ([[User talk:AllyD|talk]]) 15:16, 16 September 2012 (UTC) == Please cease and desist == You have now re-created the [[:International Turnkey Systems]] article - which appears to be your sole interest here - several times and each time it gets proposed for deletion. Assuming it gets deleted again, can you please ''not'' re-create it yet again? And [[:WP:COI]] is worth reading. [[User:AllyD|AllyD]] ([[User talk:AllyD|talk]]) 15:20, 16 September 2012 (UTC) ===advice=== Wikipedia does not include advertising. A Wikipedia article needs to be written like an encyclopedia article, not a press release, Remember not to copy from a web site, even your own -- ''first'' it's a copyright violation, but, ''even'' if you own the copyright and are willing to give us permission according to [[WP:DCM]], the tone will not be encyclopedic and the material will not be suitable. But a Wikipedia article needs to show notability with references providing substantial coverage from 3rd party independent published reliable sources, print or online, but not blogs or press releases, or material derived from press releases. Unless you have such sources, there's no point in trying. I have blocked re-creation of the article. If you think you have suitable sources, let me know on my talk page. [[User:Noq|noq]] ([[User talk:Noq|talk]]) 14:28, 11 November 2012 (UTC) ==[[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|Speedy deletion]] nomination of [[:File:M-aljedei1.jpg]]== [[Image:Copyright-problem.svg|48px|left|alt=|link=]] A tag has been placed on [[:File:M-aljedei1.jpg]] requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#F9|section F9 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because the image appears to be a blatant [[Wikipedia:Copyrights|copyright]] infringement. For legal reasons, we cannot accept copyrighted images or text borrowed from other web sites or printed material, and as a consequence, your addition will most likely be deleted. Wikipedia takes copyright violations very seriously and persistent violators '''will be [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked from editing]]'''. If you think this page should not be deleted for this reason, you may '''contest the nomination''' by [[:File:M-aljedei1.jpg|visiting the page]] and clicking the button labelled "Click here to contest this speedy deletion". This will give you the opportunity to explain why you believe the page should not be deleted. However, be aware that once a page is tagged for speedy deletion, it may be removed without delay. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag from the page yourself, but do not hesitate to add information in line with [[Wikipedia:List of policies|Wikipedia's policies and guidelines]]. [[User:Stefan2|Stefan2]] ([[User talk:Stefan2|talk]]) 14:10, 13 January 2014 (UTC)

content:
'''Welcome!'''

Hello, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia, the greatest encyclopedia on Earth! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are a few good links for newcomers: 
*[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]]
*[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Editing tutorial]]
*[[Wikipedia:Picture tutorial|Picture tutorial]]
*[[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]]
*[[Wikipedia:Naming conventions|Naming conventions]]
*[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] 

I noticed you are known only as an IP address; that means you are not signed up.  When you are you will get a username like mine. (See [[Wikipedia:Why create an account?]]). It only takes a username and password to sign up, no information needed (go to [[Special:Userlogin]] to sign up). Once you are signed up, you will have a recognizable name that others can use in identifying and corresponding with you. In addition, you might want to add yourself to the [[Wikipedia:New user log|new user log]].

I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! By the way, you can sign your name on Talk and vote pages using three tildes, like this: ~~~. Four tildes (~~~~) produces your name and the current date. If you have any questions, see the [[Wikipedia:Help|help pages]], add a question to the [[Wikipedia:village pump|village pump]] or ask me on [[{{ns:3}}:Eliezer|my talk page]]. Again, welcome! --[[User:Eliezer|Eliezer]] | [[User_talk:Eliezer|<small>£€åV€ m€ å m€§§åg€</small>]] 14:04, 7 August 2005 (UTC)

title: Samuel Brewer (dissenter)
content:
[[File:Samuel Brewer (1724-1793).jpg|right|thumb|Samuel Brewer in 1774]]
'''Samuel Brewer''' (1724 – 11 June, 1796) was an English [[dissenter|dissenting]] clergyman who was minister at the [[Stepney Meeting House]], [[London]], from 1746 to 1796.<ref name=DC>{{cite web|title=Brewer, Samuel|url=https://collections.dartmouth.edu/occom/html/ctx/personography/pers0094.ocp.html|website=Dartmouth College Library Digital Collections|publisher=Dartmouth College|accessdate=23 December 2015}}</ref> He succeeded John Hubbard.<ref name=BHO>{{cite web|title=Stepney|url=http://www.british-history.ac.uk/london-environs/vol3/pp418-488|website=British History Online|publisher=Institute of Historical Research|accessdate=23 December 2015}}</ref>

==Life==
When Brewer took over Stepney Meeting House, the congregation was quite small, but over the years he built it up.<ref name=DC/> He was not sectarian maintaining friendly relations with [[Church of England|Anglicans]] from the [[established church]].<ref name=DC/>

He was particularly friends with [[George Whitefield]], and also very supportive to [[Samson Occom]] and [[ Nathaniel Whitaker]] during their visit to [[London]] to raise money for a [[Christian]] church in [[New Hampshire]] in [[British Colonial America]].<ref name=DC/>

George Ford provided his funeral oration.<ref>{{cite web|title=The good man, and faithful minister, made eminently useful. A funeral sermon, preached at Stepney meeting, June 19, 1796, occasioned by the death of the Rev. Samuel Brewer, ... Together with the oration delivered at the interment. By George Ford.|url=https://library.villanova.edu/Find/Record/837102|website=Villanova University Holdings|accessdate=23 December 2015}}</ref>

His grandson was the hymnist [[James Edmeston]].<ref name=Hymnary>{{cite web|last1=Julian|first1=John|title=James Edmeston|url=http://www.hymnary.org/person/Edmeston_J|website=Hymnary.org|publisher=Harry Plantinga|accessdate=23 December 2015}}</ref>

==References==

title: User talk:90.195.145.99
content:
== Welcome! == '''Welcome!''' Hello, and [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/90.195.145.99|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages you might like to see: * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Help:Contents|Help pages]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] * [[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] and [[Wikipedia:Article development|How to develop articles]] * [[Wikipedia:Your first article|How to create your first article]] (using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard|Article Wizard]] if you wish) * [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] You are welcome to continue editing articles without [[Special:Userlogin|logging in]], but many editors recommend that you '''[{{fullurl:Special:Userlogin|type=signup}} create an account]'''. Doing so is free, requires no personal information, and provides several benefits such as the ability to create articles. title: Draft:Clinical Research Advantage, Inc.
content:
{{AFC submission|d|corp|declinets=20140117231307|decliner=Rinkle gorge|ts=20131211182812|u=LMPRCC|ns=5|small=yes}}{{AFC submission|d|v|declinets=20131127193144|decliner=Tikuko|ts=20131127183423|u=LMPRCC|ns=5}}

'''Clinical Research Advantage, Inc.''' (CRA) is a privately owned network of clinical trial sites. Its headquarters are in [[Tempe, Arizona]].<ref>[http://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=54860878 "Company Overview of Clinical Research Advantage, Inc."]. ''Bloomberg Business'', February 12, 2016</ref>  CRA works with pharmaceutical companies, biotech firms and contract research organizations to conduct phase II – IV clinical trials for pharmaceuticals, vaccines and medical devices. CRA has more than 70 locations throughout the United States.

CRA was founded in [[Scottsdale, Arizona]] in 1992. In 1997, the company was acquired by healthcare industry entrepreneurs Mark S. Hanley and David M. Bruggeman. In 2010, Kinderhook Industries, LLC, a New York-based private equity group, was brought in to fund further expansion.

Clinical Research Advantage is primarily a community-based network of sites; these are clinical research sites that are located within the offices of community physicians. However, in 2012, CRA purchased Cincinnati, Ohio-based Radiant Research. Radiant Research is comprised of 20 stand-alone clinical trial facilities. In 2013, CRA purchased the late phase division of Miami, Florida-based Comprehensive Clinical Development.

== History ==

1992 – CRA was founded in Scottsdale, Arizona in 1992.  In 2007 CRA was purchased by Mark S. Hanley and David M. Bruggeman. IN 2010 – CRA opened new sites in the Southwest and Midwest USA.

In 2010 CRA secured $50 million in private equity from Kinderhook Industries, LLC<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/print-edition/2010/10/29/Clinical-trial-manager-to-acquire.html "Clinical trial manager poised to acquire two competitors"]. ''Phoenix Business Journal''. Oct 29, 2010,  Angela Gonzales</ref> In 2012 CRA partnered with Quintiles to host clinical trials in family medicine.  That year 2012 CRA acquired Cincinnati, Ohio-based Radiant Research, which operated mainly along the US East Coast.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/news/2012/11/12/cra-holdings-buys-radiant-research.html "CRA Holdings Buys Radiant Research"] The Phoenix Business Journal, November 12, 2012.</ref><ref>[http://www.fiercecro.com/story/cra-buys-radiant-research-increase-trial-capacity/2012-11-12 "CRA Buys Radiant Research to Increase Trial Capacity"] Fierce CRO, November 12, 2012.</ref>

In 2013 CRA acquired the late phase clinical trial division of Miami, Florida-based Comprehensive Clinical<ref>[http://www.centerwatch.com/news-online/article/5052/clinical-research-advantage-acquires-late-phase-division-of-comprehensive-clinical-development "Clinical Research Advantage Acquires Late Phase Division of Comprehensive Clinical Development"] Centerwatch July 24, 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.pharmatimes.com/Article/12-11-27/Quintiles_hooks_up_with_Clinical_Research_Advantage_network.aspx "Quintiles Hooks Up with Clinical Research Advantage Network]” PharmaTimes, November 27, 2012. </ref>  That year the company sold Radient to Accelovance.<ref>[http://www.pharmatimes.com/Article/13-03-12/Accelovance_broadens_therapeutic_scope_with_Radiant_Development_acquisition.aspx " Accelovance broadens therapeutic scope with Radiant Development acquisition"]. ''Pharma Times'',  March 12, 2013. Peter Mansell</ref>

==Awards==

Clinical Research Advantage and its employees have received many awards, including the 2012 Vaccine Industry Excellence (ViE) Award for Best Clinical Trial Site Network,<ref>[http://www.centerwatch.com/news-online/article/3237/cra-wins-vie-award-for-best-clinical-trial-site-network "CRA Wins ViE Award for Best Clinical Trial Site Network"] Centerwatch, April 18, 2012.</ref> and the 2012 Top 25 Workplaces for Women Award presented by AZ Magazine.<ref>[http://crastudies.com/images/press/Top_25_Workplaces.pdf "Top 25 Workplaces for Women"] AZ Magazine, March 1, 2012.</ref> In 2013, CRA was named one of Arizona’s Most Admired Companies,<ref>[http://www.bestcompaniesaz.com/resources/resource-video-library/item/729-clinical-research-advantage-wins-2013-arizonas-most-admired-companies-fastest-growing-award Arizona’s Most Admired Companies] AZBestCompanies & AZ Business Magazine, September 1, 2013.</ref> and the company received the Spotlight Award for Fastest-Growing Company of the Year. CRA was ranked the #2 Fastest-Growing Company of the Year in the 2013 Arizona Corporate Excellence (ACE) Awards presented by the Phoenix Business Journal.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/print-edition/2013/09/20/newcomers-paths-to-ace-top-50-vary.html?page=all "Newcomers Paths to ACE Top 50 Vary"] The Phoenix Business Journal, Sept. 20, 2013.</ref> Mark S. Hanley, the company’s CEO, and David M.Bruggeman, COO, have been featured in PharmaVOICE Magazine’s annual list of the 100 Most Inspiring People in the Life Sciences Industry.<ref>[http://www.pharmavoice.com/archives/article.esiml?id=2507 "100 Most Inspiring"] PharmaVOICE, August 1, 2012.</ref><ref>[http://crastudies.com/images/press/PharmaVOICE0713-ClinicalResearchAdvantage-Bruggeman.pdf "100 Most Inspiring"] PharmaVOICE, August 1, 2013.</ref>

'''Casillas''' is a city in the [[Guatemala]]n [[Departments of Guatemala|department]] of 
[[Santa Rosa Department, Guatemala|Santa Rosa]]. It serves as the municipal seat for the surrounding [[municipality]] of the same name.
The city's population is approximately 6,500 and the spoken language is [[Spanish language|Spanish]].

Nearby villages include El Jute, Minas, Guadalupe, Chapas, San Juan Tapalapa, El Palmar. The nearest town is Nueva Santa Rosa.

The population is mainly [[Roman Catholic]] and the city's festivities to honor the "Cristo Negro" take place from January 12 to January 16. The fair consists of many events, including dances, a rodeo, and carnival rides.

Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your comments]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your IP address (or username if you're logged in) and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on [[User talk:BracketBot|my talk page]], or ask your question and then place {{[[:Category:Wikipedians looking for help|helpme]]}} before the question on this page. Again, welcome! == December 2013 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|alt=|link=]] Hello, I'm [[User:BracketBot|BracketBot]]. I have automatically detected that [//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=584370767 your edit] to [[Mayor–council government]] may have broken the [[syntax]] by modifying 2 "[]"s and 2 "{}"s likely mistaking one for another. If you have, don't worry: just [{{fullurl:Mayor–council government|action=edit&minor=minor&summary=Fixing+typo+raised+by+%5B%5BUser%3ABracketBot%7CBracketBot%5D%5D}} edit the page] again to fix it. If I misunderstood what happened, or if you have any questions, you can leave a message on [//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?action=edit&preload=User:A930913/BBpreload&editintro=User:A930913/BBeditintro&minor=&title=User_talk:A930913&preloadtitle=BracketBot%20–%20{{subst:REVISIONUSER}}§ion=new my operator's talk page]. :List of unpaired brackets remaining on the page: *The strong-mayor form of mayor–council government usually consists of an {{red|'''[['''}}executive (government)|executitle=The Relative Efficiency of City Manager and Mayor–Council Forms * month=July | year=1990| volume=57| issue=1| pages=167–177|doi=10.2307/1060487 | jstor=1060487{{red|'''}}'''}} Thanks, [[User:BracketBot|BracketBot]] ([[User talk:BracketBot|talk]]) 15:07, 3 December 2013 (UTC)
